poem:
**Borderline Hemlines**

In the split-screen landscape,  
where pixels carve the edge of reason,  
Hannah weaves the old into her threadbare youth,  
and Christie stalks the horizon with a night-vision gaze—  
click,  
the screen goes black.  
Behind every avatar, a shadow,  
behind every shadow,  
a name etched in digital ink.
